verses.roman:
nava śata-ghaṭa jala kaila upanīta
nānā vādya-bherī bāje, strī-gaṇa gāya gīta

synonyms: nava—nine; śata-ghaṭa—hundreds of waterpots; jala—water; kaila—made; upanīta—brought; nānā—various; vādya—musical sounds; bherī—bugles; bāje—vibrate; strī-gaṇa—all the women; gāya—chant; gīta—various songs.
translation: When the Deity was being installed, nine hundred pots of water were brought from Govinda-kuṇḍa. There were musical sounds of bugles and drums and the singing of women.
